info.title: VMware Aria Automation Assembler / Service Broker API
info.description:
A multi-cloud API for Cloud Automation Services

The APIs that list collections of resources also support OData like implementation. Below query params can be used across Assembler / Service Broker entities.

Example:

1. `$orderby` - returns a result with the rows being sorted by the values of provided attribute.

    ```/catalog/api/items?$orderby=name%20desc```

2. `$top`, `$skip` - `$top` returns the requested number of resources. Used with `$skip`, the client can skip a given number of resources.

    ```/catalog/api/items?$top=10&$skip=2```

3. `page` and `size` - page used in conjunction with `$size` helps in pagination of resources.

    ```/catalog/api/items?page=0&size=5```

license.name: Copyright (c) 2022 VMware, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

get.summary: Find the pricing card with specified Id
get.description: Returns the pricing card with the specified id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: pricing card Id

parameters.description: pricing card Id

delete.description: Deletes the pricing card with the specified id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: pricing card Id

get.summary: Fetch all pricing cards for private-policy cloud
get.description: Returns a paginated list of pricing cards

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by name and description

parameters.name: expandPricingCard
parameters.description: Whether or not returns detailed pricing card for each result.

parameters.name: expandAssignmentInfo
parameters.description: Whether or not returns count of assignments.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records you want

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records you want to skip

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property (asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: A subset of records that satisfy the given predicate expression
parameters.example: startswith(name, 'Act'), toupper(name) eq 'ACTIVATE', substringof('renameVM', name), name eq 'ABCD'

post.description: Create a new pricing card based on request body and validate its field according to business rules.

post.summary: Create or update a catalog source. Creating or updating also imports (or re-imports) the associated catalog items.
post.description: Creates a new catalog source or updates an existing catalog source based on the request body and imports catalog items from it.

parameters.name: validationOnly
parameters.description: If true, the source will not be created. It returns the number of items belonging to the source. The request will still return an error code if the source is invalid.

parameters.description: Deployment ID

parameters.name: forceDelete
parameters.description: Guarantees the deployment's deletion and all related resources from VMware Aria Automation. In some situations, this may leave provisioned infrastructure resources behind. Please ensure you remove them manually in such cases.

parameters.name: deploymentId

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Results must have exactly this name.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: A comma-separated list. Results must be associated with one of these statuses.

parameters.name: projects
parameters.description: A comma-separated list. Results must be associated with one of these project IDs.

parameters.name: resourceTypes
parameters.description: A comma-separated list. Results must be associated with one of these resourceType Names.

parameters.name: ownedBy
parameters.description: A comma-separated list. Results must be associated with one of these owners

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A comma-separated list. Results must be associated with one of these tags

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Comma-separated start and end dates where start date or end date is optional (e.g. [2020-12-01T08:00:00.000Z,2020-12-11T23:59:00.000Z], [2020-11-03T08:00:00.000Z,], [,2020-11-08T08:00:00.000Z])

parameters.name: expiresAt
parameters.description: Comma-separated start and end dates where start date or end date is optional (e.g. [2020-12-01T08:00:00.000Z,2020-12-11T23:59:00.000Z], [2020-11-03T08:00:00.000Z,], [,2020-11-08T08:00:00.000Z])

parameters.name: lastUpdatedAt
parameters.description: Comma-separated start and end dates where start date or end date is optional (e.g. [2020-12-01T08:00:00.000Z,2020-12-11T23:59:00.000Z], [2020-11-03T08:00:00.000Z,], [,2020-11-08T08:00:00.000Z])

parameters.name: expandResources
parameters.description: The 'resources' field of each resulting deployment will be retrieved.

parameters.name: expandLastRequest
parameters.description: Expands deployment last request.

parameters.name: expandProject
parameters.description: The 'project' field of each resulting deployment will be retrieved.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The expanded details of the requested comma separated objects. 'resources' option returns resources with all properties. Ex. blueprint, project

parameters.name: lastRequestStatus
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of last request statuses. Allowed values are: ABORTED, APPROVAL_PENDING, APPROVAL_REJECTED, FAILED, INPROGRESS, PENDING and SUCCESSFUL. Results must be associated with one of these last request statuses.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Retrieves only soft-deleted deployments that have not yet been completely deleted.

parameters.description: Number of records you want

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records you want to skip

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property (asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: A subset of records that satisfy the given predicate expression
parameters.example: startswith(name, 'Act'), toupper(name) eq 'ACTIVATE', substringof('renameVM', name), name eq 'ABCD'

parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property (asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: A subset of records that satisfy the given predicate expression
parameters.example: startswith(name, 'Act'), toupper(name) eq 'ACTIVATE', substringof('renameVM', name), name eq 'ABCD'

parameters.description: The interval of the expense history. Should be one of daily, weekly or monthly.

get.summary: Get about page
get.description:
The page contains information about the supported API versions and the latest API version. The version parameter is optional but highly recommended.
If you do not specify explicitly an exact version, you will be calling the latest supported API version.
Here is an example of a call which specifies the exact version you are using: `GET /catalog/api/items?apiVersion=2020-09-20`

delete.description: Deletes the entitlement with the specified id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Entitlement id

bulkRequestLimit.description: Max number of instances that can be requested at a time

AdminCatalogItemPatch.description: The patch that apply to the item

AdminCatalogItemVersionPatch.description: The patch that apply to the item

apiVersion.description: The version of the API in yyyy-MM-dd format (UTC).

documentationLink.description: The link to the documentation of this api version

ApiDescription.description: A collection of all currently supported api versions.

id.description: The id of a billing metric.

displayName.description: The display name of a billing metric.

value.description: The value of a billing metric.

supportedApis.description: A collection of all currently supported api versions.

latestApiVersion.description: The latest version of the API in yyyy-MM-dd format (UTC).

CatalogAbout.description: State object representing an about page that includes api versioning information

projectIds.description: Associated project IDs that can be used for requesting

items.description: Associated project IDs that can be used for requesting

projects.description: Associated projects that can be used for requesting

bulkRequestLimit.description: Max number of instances that can be requested at a time

CatalogItem.description: Represents a Catalog Item that can eventually be requested by a consumer.

projectId.description: Project to be used for the request

version.description: Version of the catalog item. e.g. v2.0

bulkRequestCount.description: Deployment request count; defaults to 1 if not specified.

CatalogItemRequest.description: A request to create a deployment based on a catalog item

CatalogItemRequestResponse.description: The blueprint service's response to a deployment request

dailyTotalPrice.description: Total Price of the catalog resource.

dailyComputePrice.description: Compute Price of the catalog resource.

dailyStoragePrice.description: Storage Price of the catalog resource.

dailyNetworkPrice.description: Network Price of the catalog resource.

dailyAdditionalPrice.description: Additional Price incurred for the catalog.

CatalogItemResourceUpfrontPriceResponse.description: A response with upfront price for a resource in given catalog item

id.description: Human-readable unique ID containing only lowercase letters and periods, neither starting nor ending with a period, and never having two consecutive periods

baseUri.description: Base callback URI for import operations

CatalogItemType.description: Represents a type of Catalog Item.

dailyAdditionalPrice.description: Additional Price incurred for the catalog.

CatalogItemUpfrontPriceResponse.description: The response to a catalog item upfront price request

CatalogItemVersion.description: Represents a version of a Catalog Item that can be requested by a consumer.

typeId.description: Type of source, e.g. blueprint, CFT... etc

projectId.description: Project id where the source belongs

global.description: Global flag indicating that all the items can be requested across all projects.

CatalogSource.description: The catalog source to be created

id.description: Id of either the catalog source or catalog item.

name.description: Name of either the catalog item or the catalog source

description.description: Description of either the catalog item or the catalog source

numItems.description: Number of items in the associated catalog source

iconId.description: Icon id of associated catalog item (if association is with catalog item)

ContentDefinition.description: Represents a catalog item or content source that is linked to a project via an entitlement.

Criteria.description: Policy-type-specific target object filter criteria applied during enforcement.

leaseGracePeriodDays.description: Deployment lease grace period before deletion in days

deleted.description: Indicates whether the deployment is deleted or not.

resources.description: Expanded resources for the deployment. Content of this property will not be maintained backward compatible

status.description: Represents the status of deployment with respect to its life cycle operations - create/update/delete.

Deployment.description: A group of resources such as machines, network, software, etc... typically provisioned together to deliver a complete/workable application.

currency.description: The currency code of the expense history.

data.description: The list of expense history metric.

dependsOn.description: A list of other resources this resource depends on

items.description: A list of other resources this resource depends on

state.description: The current state of the resource

DeploymentResource.description: A resource part of a deployment.

DeploymentUpdate.description: A set of fields to overwrite the corresponding fields in the deployment

name.description: Short user-friendly label of the event (e.g. 'shutting down myVM')

details.description: Longer user-friendly details of the event.

resourceName.description: Optional resource name to which the event applies to

resourceType.description: Optional resource type to which the event applies to

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the Event (e.g. date format '2019-07-13T23:16:49.310Z').

hasLogs.description: Indicates whether the event has logs or not.

userEvent.description: Indicates if the event represents user input.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the Event log (e.g. date format '2019-07-13T23:16:49.310Z').

rownum.description: Row number of the Event Log.

eof.description: Indicates whether this is the last log entry.

additionalExpense.description: Additional expense incurred for the resource.

code.description: Expense sync message code if any.

FormDefinition.description: Resource action custom UI definition. Optional

JsonSchemaImpl.description: Schema describing a policy object of this type

limitReached.description: Boolean field to indicate whether a limit has been reached or exceeded.

LimitUsageResponse.description: Response to indicate if the limit has been exceeded including the usage information.

MeteringAssignmentStrategy.description: Pricing card assignment strategy with 'EntityType' to override the strategy for the org

MeteringPolicy.description: The pricing card to be created

MeteringPolicyAssignment.description: A pricing card assignment with pricing card Id to override existing pricing card Id

groupRecipients.description: List of group recipients (max 10 groups, max 500 users/group will receive the notification)

items.description: List of group recipients (max 10 groups, max 500 users/group will receive the notification)

NotificationScenarioBranding.description: The notification scenario branding to be created or updated

NotificationScenarioConfig.description: The notification scenario configuration to be created or updated

Page.description: Project callback response containing count of deployments

enforcementType.description: Defines enforcement type for policy. Default enforcement type is HARD.

orgId.description: The ID of the organization to which the policy belongs.

projectId.description: For project-scoped policies, the ID of the project to which the policy belongs.

opaRegoCriteria.description: OPA Rego code applied during enforcement to filter target objects.

Policy.description: The policy to be created or updated

PolicyDecisionObjectNode.description: A decision made to enforce policies.

PolicyDryRunDecisionPage.description: A page of policy decisions that indicates whether a corresponding dry run is complete.

PolicyFeatureConfig.description: Defines configuration options for policy type

PolicyType.description: A type of policy that includes the schema of the policy itself and the schema of the objects affected by the policy

ProviderSchemaImpl.description: Json schema that represents resource type, a simplified version of http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-validation.html#rfc.section.5

name.description: Short user-friendly label of the request (e.g. 'shuting down myVM')

blueprintId.description: Identifier of the requested blueprint in the form 'UUID:version'

catalogItemId.description: Identifier of the requested catalog item in the form 'UUID:version'

deploymentId.description: Identifier of the requested deployment id to which the request applies to

resourceIds.description: Optional resource ids to which the request applies to

items.description: Optional resource ids to which the request applies to

resources.description: Optional affected resources details to which the request applies to

details.description: Longer user-friendly details of the request.

estimatedCompletionTime.description: Estimated time of completion (e.g. date format '2019-07-13T23:16:49.310Z').

initializedAt.description: Time at which the request was initialized.

completedAt.description: Time at which the request completed.

approvedAt.description: Time at which the request was approved.

totalTasks.description: The total number of tasks need to be completed to fulfil this request.

completedTasks.description: The number of tasks completed while fulfilling this request.

dismissed.description: Indicates whether request is in dismissed state.

cancelable.description: Indicates whether request can be canceled or not.

billable.description: Indicates whether the resource is billable or not. This is only visible ORG admins

valid.description: Resource action is valid for current state

actionId.description: The id of the action to perform.

reason.description: Reason for requesting a day2 operation

ResourceReference.description: Optional affected resources details to which the request applies to

deploymentId.description: Identifier of the requested deployment id to which the request applies to

ResourceSpecification.description: The resource spec to create a resource.

createdBy.description: Name of the user who created the resource type.

updatedBy.description: Name of the user who updated the resource type.

createdAt.description: Time at which the resource type was created.

updatedAt.description: Time at which the resource type was updated.

orgId.description: Org ID where resource type belongs

projectId.description: Project ID where resource type belongs

accountType.description: Optional. Account type to which the resource type belongs to. Example: AWS, Azure etc

composable.description: Composable with other types or not

value.description: The expense value at the timestamp.

TimeSeriesValue.description: A timeseries object containing timestamp and price value at the timestamp

count.description: Current count of resource(ex: policy) in an org

limit.description: Maximum limit on the resource(ex: policy) that can be created in an org

Usage.description: Usage includes current count and the limit on the resource(ex: policy) in an org

name.description: Short user-friendly label of the event

details.description: Details of the user event. If the event is a user interaction the details contain the vRO Manual User Interaction ID.

additionalProperties.description: User event inputs. If user event is a user interaction the inputs form can be retrieved from Orchestrator Gateway API /vro/forms/user-interaction/{userInteractionId}

inputs.description: User event inputs. If user event is a user interaction the inputs form can be retrieved from Orchestrator Gateway API /vro/forms/user-interaction/{userInteractionId}

createdAt.description: Time at which the event was created

updatedAt.description: Time at which the event was updated

UserEvent.description: Represents events which require user input.
